column4: hello everyone, I try to create a ubuntu 10.04 live cd with persistent storage using the "startup disk creator", but I cannot boot from it, getting the error " can not mount /dev/loop0 on //filesystem.squashfs"....ISO image is okay, booting from this image also works when not created using "startup disk creator"...can someone help?
What type of disk did you write to?
What computer are you trying to boot with it?
a netbook...I tried with another computer as well, didnt work either
can boot from another 10.04 usb stick though
So the co,puter cant boot from just this one flash drive?
I think the problem is that the "startup disk creator" of 10.04 creates invalid media when using the "persitent files" feature
but I don't know how to fix this
Give me a second, let me see if I can find something.
thanks, I also did some googling, the error is quite unspecific unfortunately :(
So it is only the flash drive that is set to persistent?
I did not yet try to create a non-persistent disk with THIS stick...thats the next thing Im going to try
You might want to try that, since this issue is really unknown.
okay, going to try...thanks for now, I'll give feedback when I know more
Okay. Good luck, I will continue to look for something.
I now created the stick without using the "peristent storage" feature, and indeed it works!
